Class MazeLevel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Level
              • MazeLevel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class MazeLevel
extends Level
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The class responsible for creating a basic maze level (subtype of Level), which includes a maze. The maze contains a 2D array of rooms, and each element in the matrix contains a problem that must be solved. Solving the problem onlocks the doors to the other rooms. Incorrectly answering a question will lose the player health. Problems are solved by stepping on the correct button. The level is beaten once the player reaches the boss level. This class also detects keyboard input and draws graphics accordingly. The level is all contained within a JPanel.
    Version:
    5.0
    Author:
    Aviv Haber. Created class and wrote code for wall collision May 25. Implemented room change system May 29. Implemented bottom UI bar June 1. Approximate Work: 7 hours, Rian Waterson. Wrote code for button collision, problem solving, and door breaking May 31. Fixed bug where game froze after solving problem June 2. Approximate Work: 7 hours
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MazeLevel

        public MazeLevel(int num)
        Creates the JPanel, initializes all the instance variables, and loads the images.
        Parameters:
        num - The level number.

    • Method Detail

      • detectButtonCollision

        public void detectButtonCollision()
        Analyzes the coordinates of the player and the buttons to see if the player stepped on a button. If they have, the appropriate logic will be carried out.

      • detectWallCollision

        public void detectWallCollision()
        Analyzes the velocities and coordinats of the player and determines whether the player is allowed to move past walls. If the player is allowed to move, this method also increments the player's X and Y values.

      • detectRoomChange

        public void detectRoomChange()
        Analyzes the player's coordinates to see if they have changed rooms. If they have, the rows and column variables are incremented, the coordinates are updated, and the character index is adjusted.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the required images on screen. This is called as necessary for every iteration in the game loop.
        Specified by:
        paintComponent in class Level
        Parameters:
        g - Object containing graphics context that is used for rendering images and 2d shapes.

      • run

        public int[] run()
        The main game loop for the level. It calls the collision and coordinate update methods. It also sleeps for 4ms. It only calls repaint if there has been a change since the last iteration (ie. a KeyEvent). It also detects win conditions and exits as necessary.
        Specified by:
        run in class Level
        Returns:
        An integer array of 2 elements where the first element is the termination code and the second element is the time it took to beat the level, in milliseconds. A code of 0 means the level was beaten normally. Anything else indicates that the player died in the level.
